info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 20 at 10:02PM EDT until July 20 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson KY
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Portions of east central and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in east central Kentucky, Menifee, Montgomery and Powell. In southeast Kentucky, Wolfe.
* WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 959 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to earlier thunderstorms, with lighter rain ongoing. Minor flooding is likely ongoing within the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall is likely over the area later tonight. This additional rain may result in minor flooding and could eventually lead to flash flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stanton, Frenchburg, Campton, Jeffersonville, Camargo, Clay City, Wellington, Campsites in the Indian Creek area of the Daniel Boone National Forrest, Bowen, Lombard, Nada, Cat Creek, Haystack, Rosslyn, Fagan, Slade, Means, Rogers Chapel, Cedar Groves and Cornwell.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Menifee, KY; Montgomery, KY; Powell, KY; Wolfe, KY
